section.p: Operations Behavior Anomaly DetectionStellarProtect provides the Operations Behavior Anomaly Detection to protect the endpoints from fileless attacks.

Click the Agents tab in the top navigation bar of the StellarOne web console. Click the All group on the Agents screen. The Agents screen displays a list of agents managed by StellarOne. Navigate to the target agent or group and click the Policy Inheritance link.
Scroll down and find the Operations Behavior Anomaly Detection.

Basically, the Operations Behavior Anomaly Detection has four modes:
Operations Behavior Anomaly DetectionLearn ModeLearn: Under this mode, StellarProtect will monitor unrecognized program calls and add them to the trusted-operation list. In this way, the agent will continuously learn more and more OT-related program call behaviors.
Operations Behavior Anomaly DetectionDetect ModeDetect: Under this mode, StellarProtect wil monitor unrecognized program calls and log them for future analysis.
Operations Behavior Anomaly DetectionEnforce ModeEnforce: Under this mode, StellarProtect will monitor unrecognized program calls and block them to secure the endpoint.
Operations Behavior Anomaly DetectionDisable ModeDisable: Under this mode, the Operations Behavior Anomaly Detection is disabled and protection for fileless attacks is turned off.
In either Detect or Enforce mode, users have one more option, Aggressive Mode, for stronger antivirus protection. Please refer to for more details.
Users can manually add commonly-abused applications used in operations and processes to the Watchlist for strengthening security monitoring. Please refer to for more details.
